name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we can analyze by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 1-methyl-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole, which has a melting point of around 106°C. The additional functional groups and structural features in 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole will affect its melting point: (1) The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which might raise the melting point by approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. (2) The two phenyl groups contribute to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at approximately +20°C each. (3) The trimethylphenyl group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at approximately +30°C.
